Transcript: There was once a naval officer who after marriage was going for his first voyage with his wife on the ship.
Unfortunately, the ship got caught in a storm on the high seas and it was getting tossed by the waves.
Everybody in that ship was anxious except for the sailor.
His wife, looking at his calm demeanor said, my dear husband,
how are you so calm in such a difficult situation?
He smiled, he took out his sword from the sheath and placed the blade on his wife's head.
He said, my dear wife, are you worried?
She said, no, why not? This naked blade is on your head, it can go right through your skull.
She said, it's in your hands, the sword and I have faith that you are my well-wisher.
What's there to be scared about?
The naval officer said, in the same way, I have faith that this ship is on the hands of God
and whatever he does will be for my best interest because he is my well-wisher.
That faith frees us from anxieties of the present and helps us focus on doing our best.
And that ultimately is the way for building our future.
So rather than worry about the future, we can simplify the game of life.
Do your best and leave to God on the rest.
